src:
Milan Pavkov na 180 stepeni
Šta se desilo sa miljenikom Zvezdinih navijača?
07 Nov 2019 by Aleksandar Gligorić
Ime Milana Pavkova je 7. novembra prošle godine bilo na usnama svakog navijača Crvene zvezde. Tačno godinu dana kasnije, njegovo ime je opet najčešće pominjano među zvezdašima. Nažalost, iz drugog razloga. Potpuno suprotnog.
Opevani heroj čuvene pobede nad Liverpulom je godinu dana kasnije navukao kožu tragičara.“Eh, da ga je dao Pavkov…”, uglavnom je bio početak većine razgovora među Zvezdinim navijačima ovog jutra.
I stvarno, šta da ga je dao Pavkov? Zvezda bi pobedila Totenhem? Vrlo moguće… Ovaj Totenhem je sigurno slabija ekipa od onog Liverpula. Bez obzira na to što su dali Zvezdi devet golova u dve utakmice, Spursi su ekipa protiv koje lakše može da se igra nego protiv Klopovih Redsa. To je sinoć bilo očigledno. Samo ih ne treba baš častiti. A Zvezda je sinoć čašćavala šakom i kapom. U prvom redu Milan Pavkov, a za njim i kompletan vezni red crveno-belih koji je poslednju liniju ostavio na streljani kada se Zvezda nedopustivo lako raspala posle sat vremena igre.
Razlika između onod 6. novembra protiv Liverpula i ovog 6. novembra protiv Totenhema je bilo samopouzdanje i oštrina. Ono što je Zvezda imala protiv Liverpula, sinoć nije imala protiv Totenhema. Da ne upotrebimo nešto vulgarniju reč… A na primeru Milana Pavkova se to najbolje videlo. Čovek koji je leteo iznad Van Dajka, bacao Vajnalduma kao malo dete i tukao sa 30 metara po najboljem golmanu sveta, sinoć nije imao samopouzdanje da šutne?! A kada je šutnuo, bolje da nije…
Šta se u međuvremenu desilo sa miljenikom Zvezdinih navijača koji je pre godinu dana dobio i pesmu na Severu?



Sve što je moglo pogrešno da se uradi sa njim, uradilo se. Od uprave kluba do stručnog štaba. Ni kada je u Salcburgu stekao status “game changera” (da se poslužimo Trinkjerijevom kovanicom za Filipa Čovića) Pavkov nije imao puno poverenje u klubu,  nisu svi bili uvereni da je on špic na kojeg će Zvezda moći potpuno da se osloni. Zato je i doveden Ričmond Boaći. Ni kada je bacio Liverpul na kolena, opet nije stekao kredit da bude prva “devetka”. Ni kada je onom strelovitom dijagonalom spasao Zvezdu poraza u derbiju opet nije sebe u klubu etiketirao kao prvu “devetku”. Uvek je visilo u vazduhu da Zvezda treba da ga proda u najboljem trenutku kada mu cena skoči.
Zašto je to tako?
Stručni štab Crvene zvezde bolje od nas i vas poznaje Pavkova, vidi i neke stvari koje se ne vide na terenu. I tu možda leži jedan od razloga zašto Pavkov nikada nije blindirao mesto prvog špica. Možda nečim nije zaslužio? Sportski sektor u upravi Zvezde nikada nije ni bio svestan njegovih limita, niti je imao tačnu procenu njegove vrednosti. Pre Salcburga je malo falilo da ga prodaju u Segundu za nekoliko stotina hiljada evra. Koliko je Pavkov nepoznanica na tržištu za onog koji ga prodaje i onog koji bi da ga kupi, toliko je i na terenu za protivničke odbrane. Primera radi, i u Partizanu govore kako je reč o najkvalitetnijem špicu kojeg Zvezda ima na raspolaganju i da su njegovi udarci zbog uglova kojima “seče” loptu nepredvidivi za golmane.



Prošlo leto je delovalo kao raskrsnica. Ili će Pavkov otići ili će (p)ostati prvi špic.
Nervoza oko njegovog statusa je rasla u upravi, stručnom štabu i na kraju se debelo prenela i na njega. Propustio je dobar deo priprema u Austriji zbog lakše povrede iščekujući transfer. Kada je dobio ponudu iz Kine, počeo je da trenira dan pred put na Daleki istok. Izgledalo je da je sve gotovo, navijači su tiho žalili zbog odlaska svog miljenika, ali im je makar bilo "drago što se Mića Pavkov konačno naplatio”.
Posle nekoliko dana tišine i panike u klubu, Pavkov se vratio iz Kine neobavljenog posla. Ponuđeni ugovor vredan 1.500.000 evra godišnje nije prihvatio, tražio je 2.200.000 po sezoni i vratio se kući. Zvezda je već dovela toliko čekanog Tomanea, imala je Boaćija sa visokim ugovorom i sama sebe zavezala u čvor sa trojicom napadača od kojih nijedan bije bio u formi pred početak borbe za Ligu šampiona.
Tomane se povredio, pa se dugo uklapao i čekao, Boaći se konstantno mučio sa formom, a Pavkov ušao u sezonu kao rezervni špic za kojeg ima nade da će se prodati do 31. avgusta.
Da se Tomane nije povredio protiv Zvezdare, Pavkov bi verovatno od mečeva sa Helsinkijem bio treći špic. Ovako, sa povredom Portugalca je dobio šansu da bude Boaćijeva zamena i ulazio na utakmicama protiv Suduve i Helsinkija da bi zbog Ričmondove forme konačno dobio šansu protiv Kopenhagena da startuje. Izmislio ga je u svom stilu kada je opet bio na pravom mestu i nekako poslao loptu pod prečku. Povređen! Skoro celo poluvreme je igrao povređen…
I tu dolazimo do drugog problema Pavkova osim forme i statusa u klubu. Od početka sezone, Pavkov deluje kao fizički nespreman i u neku ruku zapušten igrač. Neodrađene pripreme uz njegove ne baš pohvalne radne navike su uzele danak. Mučio se na terenu, da bi ga povreda protiv Kopenhagena izbacila iz sastava za revanš u Danskoj i plej-of sa Jang Bojsima.
Ni kada se oporavio, Pavkov nije delovao spreman. Kao što nije delovao ni sinoć. Ni protiv Bajerna u Minhenu. Stalno mu fali neki centimetar u skoku, duelu, pri šutu… Redovno je jedan od igrača koji ima najmanje pretrčanih kilometara. Ali ta statistika ne bi trebalo da deluje mnogo deprimirajuće. Pavkov nije igrač koji otvara prostor drugima i radi te nevidljive poslove za ekipu. Nije taktički obučen kao Boaći (koji je prošao italijansku školu), nije ni tip poput Tomanea. Pavkov je špic koji daje golove i ne interesuje ga ništa drugo kada vidi gol. Špic kakve navijači vole jer će šutnuti loptu. A da bi se nekome dao gol, mora i da se šutne. Kod njega je to jednostavno.  



Nažalost, Milan Pavkov više ne šutira kao ranije. I dalje ima taj osećaj da uđe u šansu, ali to višemesečno nepoverenje iz kluba i stručnog štaba uz lošu fizičku spremu su otupeli golgetersku oštricu dugajlije iz Begeča. Iako i dalje pokazuje urođeni osećaj za šansu. Pala mu je lopta pred nogu i u Minhenu, ali je nije stigao. Nema više onih hitrih reakcija kao lane. Pala mu je lopta i sinoć na nogu u idealnoj šansi. Mogao je da bira šta će, Gazaniga je već bio legao... Ali bez samopouzdanja i bez vrhunske spreme, nema ni završnice. Pavkov je šutirao amaterski. Ali je makar bio u šansi.
Još više od te promašene šanse, koja je mogla da stavi Totenhem u ključao lonac “Marakane” u kojem je skuvan i Liverpul, bode oči ona šansa na početku drugog poluvremena. Čovek koji se promovisao kao klasični egzekutor toliko je izgubio na samopouzdanju da nije smeo da šutira levom nogom iz otvorene šanse, već je dodavao?! Pavkov i asistencije ne idu jedno s drugim, ali je sinoć bio u takvom psihološkom potonuću da nije smeo da šutira već je dodavao. I to jako loše. Između Garsije i Marina da se ne zna kome je išla lopta…
Pavkov u sinoćnjem izdanju je posledica mnogo toga loše odrađenog sa njegove i klupske strane u poslednjih šest meseci. Kada je zasluživao status prve “devetke”, nešto se kombinovalo i menjalo. Kada je trebalo da ode, ostao je. Kada je van forme, dobio je šansu da rani Totenhem čija odbrana je sinoć dala dovoljno prostora da se matira.
Milan Pavkov je u ovoj sezoni prvi strelac Zvezde sa osam golova u svim takmičenjima. Šest od toga je dao u Superligi Srbije. Tri od šest su došli iz penala. U Evropi je je dao dva vrlo bitna gola protiv Helsinkija i Kopenhagena. Ali to je sve zajedno je malo.
A možda i nije mogao više?
Od 18 utakmica, čak osam je ušao sa klupe za rezerve, a pet puta je zamenjen. Samo pet puta je celu utakmicu proveo na terenu. Pavkov je u ritmu od dve utakmice sedmično vezao samo dva perioda kao starter (Inđija i Bajern, Proleter i Totenhem). Da li je to zbog taktičkih zamisli Milojevića ili do njegove fizičke (ne)spreme, znaju u svlačionici Zvezde.



Ali da ovako ne ide, zaista ne ide. Šansa može da se promaši. I velikani poput Roberta Bađa su za kratak period prolazili puteve od junaka do tragičara. Rasni špic poput Gonzala Iguaina je trauma cele jedne nacije kojoj je uništio sve snove gde god se pojavio jer je promašivao šanse. Što ga ne čini lošim igračem.
Tako i Milan Pavkov ima pravo na promašenu šansu, lošu utakmicu, ali ne i na loša izdanja u kontinuitetu i odsutnost na terenu. Promašen zicer pre nekoliko dana na Kađarorđu protiv Proletera je pokazatelj da ono sinoć nije bila slučajnost. Pavkov je postao igrač koji više promašuje nego što daje. Nekad je bilo obrnuto. Ali se sve okrenulo za 180 stepeni.
Ne moraju samo ni golovi da budu merna jedinica, mada Pavkov jeste taj tip centarfora. Ono što je nekada radio kada kroči na teren, više ne radi. Sve manje dobija vazdušne duele, sve manje njegovi čuveni laktovi unose strah kod protivnika, sve manje učestvuje u igri i deluje nemoćno zbog fizičke inferiornosti. A nespreman Pavkov je nemoćan Pavkov. Iz nespreme dolazi i dekoncentracija, i na kraju spore i štetne rekacije kao sinoć. Ne samo da je Pavkov promašio vođstvo, pa izjednačenje, već je njegova loša reakcija otvorila autoput za kontru Totenhema kod drugog gola posle koje je utakmica bila ubijena, a Zvezda podigla belu zastavu.
Koliko je prošle sezone na krilima Liverpula godine dobio samopouzdanja, toliko će mu ova partija od sinoć uticati na dalji deo sezone. Pogotovo što je na kraju doživeo novu povredu i pitanje je kada će opet moći da uhvati priključak i vrati se u kakvu-takvu formu posle nove duže pauze.
A to je onda još veći problem za Crvenu zvezdu. Od trojice napadača, Zvezda nema nijednog u formi. Nijedan ne kipti od samopouzdanja što nije baš normalno za ekipu koja u domaćem prvenstvu ima skor 13-0-1 i 33 postignuta gola. Najgore je što se trenutno ni ne nazire ko je Zvezdina “devetka”. Ona na koju bi se kladili pred Pirej gde će Zvezda odigrati najvažniju utakmicu do kraja godine i moraće da postigne gol.
Deluje da Milan Pavkov nije taj čovek. A donedvano je bio igrač zbog kojeg svakom zvezdašu zaigra srce kada ga vidi da je u prvih 11 ili da se sprema da uđe sa klupe. Jer, kada je Pavkov bio na terenu, uvek se nešto dobro dešavalo po Zvezdu. Više ne… Sve se obrnulo za 180 stepeni.
 



(FOTO: Reuters, MN Press, Star sport)
text:
Milan Pavkov at 180 degrees
What happened to the Star fan favorite?
07 Nov 2019 by Aleksandar Gligoric
The name of Milan Pavkov was on the lips of every Red Star fan on November 7 last year. Exactly one year later, his name was once again most commonly mentioned among celebrities. Unfortunately for another reason. Quite the opposite.
The chanted hero of the famous victory over Liverpool a year later pulled on the skin of the tragedyman: "Eh, Pavkov gave it ..." was mostly the start of most conversations among Star fans this morning.
And really, what did Pavkov give him? Star would beat Tottenham? Very possible ... This Tottenham is certainly a weaker team than that of Liverpool. Despite giving the Stars nine goals in two games, the Spurs are a team more easily playable than the Clops Reds. That was obvious last night. They just don't have to be honored. And last night, the Star worshiped with a fist and a hat. First of all, Milan Pavkov, followed by a complete red-white midfielder who left the last line on the shooting range when the Star broke up unacceptably easily after an hour of play.
The difference between on November 6 against Liverpool and on November 6 against Tottenham was confidence and sharpness. What the star had against Liverpool did not have against Tottenham last night. Not to use a more vulgar word ... And in the example of Milan Pavkov it was best seen. The man who flew over Van Dyck, tossed Weinaldum like a toddler and beat from 30 yards on the world's best goalie, didn't have the confidence to keep quiet last night ?! And when he kicked, he better not…
What happened in the meantime to a Star fan favorite who even got a song in the North a year ago?



Anything that could go wrong with him was done. From club management to expert staff. Even when he acquired the status of a game changer in Salzburg (to use Trinkjer's coin for Philip Covic) Pavkov did not have full confidence in the club, not everyone was convinced that he was a spokesman that the Star would be able to fully rely on. That's why Richmond Boaci was brought in. Even when he dropped Liverpool to his knees, he never again earned the credit of being the first Nine. Even when he saved the star of defeat in the derby with that arrow diagonal, he again did not label himself in the club as the first "nine". It always hung in the air that the Star should sell him at the best time when his price jumped.
Why is it like that?
The Red Star professional staff is better than we are and Pavkov knows you, he also sees some things not seen on the field. And here may be one of the reasons why Pavkov never blinded the spot of the first spike. Maybe he didn't deserve something? The sports sector under the management of the Star was never aware of its limits, nor did it have an accurate estimate of its value. Before Salzburg, it was a little lacking to sell it in Segund for several hundred thousand euros. As much as Pavkov is unknown in the market for the one who sells it and the one who would buy it, so is the field for opposing defenses. For example, in Partizan, they say that this is the best quality striker available to Zvezda, and that his shots because of the angles he cuts the ball with are unpredictable for goalkeepers.



Last summer, it acted as a crossroads. Either Pavkov will leave or (p) he will remain the first spitz.
Anxiety about his status grew in the administration, the headquarters, and eventually passed on to him. He missed a good deal of preparations in Austria due to a minor injury pending transfer. When he received an offer from China, he began training the day before traveling to the Far East. It seemed to be over, fans were quietly mourning the departure of their favorite, but at least they were "glad that Micah Pavkov was finally charged."
After a few days of silence and panic at the club, Pavkov returned from an unmanaged job in China. He did not accept the offered contract worth 1,500,000 euros a year, asked for 2,200,000 per season and returned home. The star had already brought in the much awaited Tomane, had Boachi with a high contract and tied herself in a knot with three strikers, none of whom were in shape before the start of the Champions League fight.
Tomane got injured, so he fit in and waited for a long time, Boaci was constantly struggling with form, and Pavkov entered the season as a backup who he hopes will sell out by August 31st.
Had Tomane not injured himself against Zvezda, Pavkov would probably have been the third Spitz out of the match with Helsinki. Thus, with the injury to the Portuguese, he got a chance to be Boaci's replacement and went into games against Suduva and Helsinki to finally get a chance against Copenhagen because of Richmond's form. He invented it in his own style when he was in the right place again and somehow sent the ball under the crossbar. Injured! He played injured almost half the time…
And here we come to another problem for Pavkov besides his form and status in the club. Since the start of the season, Pavkov has been acting as a physically unprepared and somewhat neglected player. The poor preparation with his not very commendable work habits has taken a toll. He was struggling on the pitch to be knocked out of the Danish rematch and play-offs with the Young Boys by the injury against Copenhagen.
Even when he recovered, Pavkov didn't seem ready. Like it didn't work last night. Not even against Bayern Munich. He constantly misses an inch in jump, duel, shot ... He is regularly one of the players with the least mileage. But that statistic should not seem very depressing. Pavkov is not a player who opens space for others and does those invisible jobs for the team. Not tactically trained like Boaci (who went through an Italian school), he's not even a guy like Tomane. Pavkov is a point guard who gives goals and is not interested in anything else when he sees a goal. Spitz what fans like because they will kick the ball. And to be naked, one has to keep quiet. With him it's simple.



Unfortunately, Milan Pavkov no longer shoots as before. He still has that feeling of taking a chance, but that months of distrust from the club and his professional staff, with poor physical fitness, dulled the goalkeeper's blade from the Begecy dugout. Although it still shows an innate sense of chance. He dropped the ball at his feet and into Munich, but he didn't get it. No more of those quick reactions like flax. He dropped the ball and on his foot last night at an ideal chance. He could choose what to do, Gazaniga was already laid down ... But without confidence and without top-notch, there is no finish. Pavkov kicked amateurly. But at least he was in for a chance.
Even more than that missed chance, which could have put Tottenham in the boiling pot of Marakana in which Liverpool was also cooked, will be the eyes of that chance at the beginning of the second half. A man who promoted himself as a classic executioner lost so much confidence that he should not have kicked with his left foot from an open chance, but added ?! Pavkov and assists do not go with each other, but last night he was in such a psychological sinking that he should not have kicked but added. And very bad. Between Garcia and Marin not knowing who the ball was going…
Pavkov's release last night is a consequence of a lot of bad things done on his and his club's sides over the last six months. When he deserved the status of the first "nine", something was combined and changed. When he needed to leave, he stayed. When out of form, he got a chance to wound Tottenham, whose defense last night gave him plenty of room to mat.
Milan Pavkov is the Stars' first scorer this season with eight goals in all competitions. He gave six of them in the Serbian Super League. Three of the six came from penalties. He scored two very important goals in Europe against Helsinki and Copenhagen. But it's all together is small.
And maybe he couldn't do it anymore?
Of the 18 games, as many as eight came off the reserve bench, and he was replaced five times. Only five times he spent the entire game on the field. Pavkov tied just two periods a week as a starter in the rhythm of two games a week (Indjija and Bayern, Proleter and Tottenham). Whether it is because of Milojevic's tactical ideas or his physical (un) fitness, they know in the Star locker room.



But not to go this way, it really doesn't go. The chance may be missed. And greats like Robert Badge have traveled from hero to tragedy for a short period. A racial slur like Gonzalo Iguain is the trauma of an entire nation to which he destroyed all dreams wherever he appeared because he missed chances. Which does not make him a bad player.
So, too, Milan Pavkov is entitled to a missed chance, a bad game, but not to bad releases in continuity and absence on the pitch. A missed joke a few days ago at Kajarorje against Proleter is an indication that last night was not a coincidence. Pavkov has become a player who misses more than he gives. It used to be the other way around. But everything turned 180 degrees.
Not only goals need to be a unit of measurement, though Pavkov is that type of centerfold. What he used to do when he walks on the field is no longer working. He gets less air duels, his guarded elbows are less fearful of his opponent, he is less and less involved in the game and seems powerless due to physical inferiority. And unprepared Pavkov is powerless Pavkov. From unpreparedness comes deconcentration, and finally slow and harmful reactions like last night. Not only did Pavkov miss the lead, so the equalizer, but his bad reaction opened the highway to counter Tottenham at the second goal after which the match was killed and the Star raised the white flag.
How much confidence he has gained on the wings of Liverpool last year is how much this game will affect him for the rest of the season from last night. Especially since he eventually suffered a new injury and the question is when he will be able to catch the plug again and return to some form after another longer break.
And that is even more of a problem for the Red Star. Of the three strikers, the Star has none in form. None of them are self-confident, which is not exactly normal for a team that scores 13-0-1 and 33 goals in the domestic championship. The worst part is that it's not even clear who the Star of the Nine is. The one you would bet on before Piraeus where the Star will play the most important game by the end of the year and will have to score.
It seems Milan Pavkov is not that man. And until recently, he was a player who makes every star play a heart when he sees him in the top 11 or is about to get off the bench. Because, when Pavkov was on the field, there was always something good going on for Star. No more ... Everything turned 180 degrees.




(PHOTO: Reuters, MN Press, Star Sport)
